name: Official Plan Map 4 Review Open House
description: The purpose of this event is to gather feedback on draft changes to refresh Official Plan Map 4 and input on what data and other information should be considered as part of a full review.

name: A Northern Lights Painting Workshop
description:
Paint the Northern Lights over a serene lake at this cozy, beginner-friendly paint session! With step-by-step guidance, you'll create your own colourful night sky masterpiece while enjoying tea in a relaxed, inspiring atmosphere. No experience needed—just bring your creativity!

Please see more Paint Workshops on event website.

name: ROM The Big Chill - Environmental Crisis and Artistic Production in Korea

location.name: Royal Ontario Museum - Queens Park Entrance

description:
How has climate change influenced the art and culture of Korea? Admire treasures from the collections, as Keynote Speaker Dr. Sooa Im McCormick (Korea Foundation Curator of Korean Art of The Cleveland Museum of Art) is joined by panelists Dr. Soren Brothers (Allan and Helaine Shiff Curator of Climate Change) and Dr. Vicki Sung-yeon Kwon (Associate Curator of Korean Art and Culture, Royal Ontario Museum) to discuss this issue's effect on Korea's Joseon dynasty (1392 to 1910).

The Little Ice Age (late 14th to 19th century), a period of catastrophic global climate change caused failed harvests, famines, and epidemics all over the Northern Hemisphere, including Canada and Korea. Its impact in Korea was felt acutely in the 18th century leading to dramatic changes in visual and material culture still felt today.

The presentation will be followed by Korean-inspired refreshments and a performance of Korean traditional music quartet Haneum.

name: Story Garden: The Community Arts Guild
description: Join the Community Arts Guild at Story Garden, an engaging and evolving gallery installation at Cedar Ridge. Help seed and grow stories through drop-in creative writing, storytelling, and visual arts activities designed to spark imagination and connection. Visit Story Garden during Doors Open weekend to experience collaborative art making, live performances by professional artists and community members and a showcase of artworks created with and by Scarborough residents.

name: Jr. Forest Explorers: Nature Play
description: Imagination, exploration and fun are at the heart of this play program. We will be combining natural and human made loose parts to create an exciting forest adventure.

name: The Urban Orchestra: Sounds of Spring Concert
description:
A musical celebration of spring, and a chance to experience the power of a full symphony orchestra in an intimate setting.

From historic salons of Europe to Toronto's West end, this is the way orchestras were meant to be heard.

Concert program:
- Overture to a Distant Present (Original Canadian Composition). Samuel Bisson
- Symphony No 8 in B minor, "Unfinished", D 759. Allegro Moderato. Franz Schubert
- Overture: The Bartered Bride. Bedřich Smetana
- Symphony No. 6 in F Major, "Pastoral", OP 68.  Ludwig van Beethoven

name: Sunday Late Night Jazz Fusion Duo with The Sloth Broth Brothers
description: The Sloth Broth Brothers are a jazz fusion duo comprised of Gianluca Occhipinti on keys, synth and synth bass, and Jamie Wells on drums. Their eclectic sound is characterized by their balance of drive, spaciness and syncopation, a trifecta they use to realize creatively reverent spins on contemporary jazz pieces as well as apply to their own compositions.

name: Vessels of Memory Art Exhibition

address.streetAddress: Etobicoke Civic Centre, 399 The West Mall

description: Witness how artists of FERL Collective examine the ways in which we face the world and carry our experiences forward. Four artists offer nuanced and unique renderings of queer memories and shared histories of belonging.

name: RapidTO: Bathurst Street Public Virtual Public Meeting
description: The City of Toronto and Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) invite residents to learn more and provide feedback on RapidTO: Bathurst Street. Public opinion, along with technical and policy considerations, will be used to inform staff recommendations and decisions made by City Council. Provide feedback by attending a public event, completing the survey, email or phone. The same information will be presented at each public event.

name: Sunday Night Dinner Arabic Egyptian & Folk Music with Al Qahwa
description: Al Qahwa is Maryem Tollar on vocals, riqq (Arabic tambourine) and qanun (Arabic table harp); Ernie Tollar on wind instruments; Demetri Petsalakis on oud and Naghmeh Fahrahmand on percussion. For their fourth recording, "Weyn Allah" they added Waleed Abdulhamid on bass and vocals and Lauren Barnett (b.up vocals and sax). Roula Said (b.up vocals, percussion and dance) will join the group for this concert. Al Qahwa performs original compositions, as well as popular traditional Arabic repertoire – from Sufi Devotional Love songs from the Arab World to popular folk songs, to classic Egyptian songs made famous by the stars of Egypt (the Hollywood of the Middle East).
